title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

08:34 <jstoldt> good morning!

09:18 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <jstoldt> ah, great timing :-D  
09:26 <jstoldt> lucaa: XWIKI-5824  
09:27 <jstoldt> note i also linked (this time i related it properly, i hope) it with another ticket which is about this general topic  
09:27 <sabageru> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <jstoldt> it'd be nice to have this in the final 2.x release ;)  
09:28 <vmassol> has quit  
09:28 <+lucaa> yes, indeed I should also commit that in the branch  
09:28 <+lucaa> I will look at it, thanks for the issue  
09:28 <jstoldt> you are welcome  
09:36 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <jstoldt> lucaa: updated the ticket with one addition  
09:37 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
09:38 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:48 <+sburjan> vmassol: WebDav is GREAT for managing screenshots  
09:48 <vmassol> sburjan: yep  
09:49 <vmassol> sburjan: you could have an avatar on xwiki.org  
09:49 <vmassol> would make it easier to see when you make changes in the activity stream  
09:49 <+sburjan> so you want me to put a picture on my profile ?  
09:49 <vmassol> it's more friendly too  
09:49 <vmassol> yes  
09:49 <+sburjan> okay. I will  
09:50 <+sburjan> do you like the .org how is it now ?  
09:50 <vmassol> wdym?  
09:50 <+sburjan> do you feel like it's improved ? we worked a lot in the past 2 weeks, and not just on extensions wiki  
09:51 <vmassol> well the biggest changes are: extensions wiki and skin  
09:51 <+sburjan> ofc  
09:51 <vmassol> not much was changed in term fo content  
09:51 <+sburjan> but I mean about the screenshot and the content  
09:51 <vmassol> and organization  
09:51 <+sburjan> well a lot of screenshots were remade  
09:51 <vmassol> it's not easier for users to find content  
09:52 <vmassol> and there's not much more content  
09:52 <jstoldt> to give you my 2 cents, i think it's very good now. it was worth your effort, for all i can say  
09:52 <+sburjan> no, but it's improved  
09:52 <vmassol> I'd really like to implement horizontal nav  
09:52 <vmassol> and the rest that we proposed  
09:53 <vmassol> http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Improvements/XWikiOrgProposal2  
09:53 <lucaa> has quit  
09:54 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <vmassol> I don't know why http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/MaximeSinclair doesn't show his activity on the extensions wiki  
09:55 <jstoldt> about the nav, i personally prefere to have navigation on the left... because at least in the western world we read upper left corner to lower right corner and thus it would be more prominent on the left...  
09:55 <vmassol> jstoldt: check the link above  
09:55 <jstoldt> i did  
09:55 <vmassol> you like it?  
09:56 <jstoldt> it's good but i think you can improve it by doing as little as putting the panels on the left side  
09:56 <jstoldt> improve xwiki.org, that is  
09:56 <vmassol> jstoldt: there's a reason for the panels on the right  
09:56 <vmassol> it was to put content as the first class citizen  
09:56 <vmassol> we had an ergonomist work on that  
09:56 <vmassol> and advise us  
09:56 <vmassol> :)  
09:56 <jstoldt> okay, that is a very valid argument  
09:57 <vmassol> I also didn't like it initially  
09:57 <jstoldt> i personally prefere navigation first  
09:57 <vmassol> I was agasint it  
09:57 <vmassol> I guess I got used to it now but I agree that the first impression is strange since we're used to seeing menus on th e left  
09:57 <jstoldt> yeah, ergonomists have weird ideas. i should know, i took those classes in the last two semesters in university ;)  
09:58 <jstoldt> well, not exactly strange. it's not like it stops anyone. it's just that i personally like to have navigation first and if i want the content i proceed to the next bit of the page  
09:59 <jstoldt> how about the proposal mockup, did you work with said ergonomist on that, too?  
10:00 <vmassol> nope  
10:00 <vmassol> that proposal was done by evalica  
10:00 <jstoldt> i see  
10:00 <vmassol> and discussed on the list  
10:01 <vmassol> well the other way around, discussed led to it  
10:01 <vmassol> s/discussed/discussion/  
10:01 <jstoldt> :)  
10:01 <jstoldt> the only thing i really don't like is on the first screenshot the huge link collection  
10:01 <jstoldt> like that's too much for me to make ony sense of it without having to read it all or use ctrl + f  
10:02 <+sburjan> I really like the feature that you don't have to attach images on all pages  
10:02 <vmassol> sabageru: good monring  
10:02 <+sburjan> and you can reffer them  
10:02 <+sburjan> very cool stuff  
10:02 <sabageru> vmassol: good morning  
10:02 <jstoldt> sburjan: agreed! also keeps the database smaller!  
10:02 <+sburjan> yepp  
10:02 <vmassol> sabageru: I think there's a pb with activity stream on xwiki.org and I thought I raised an issue but can't find it  
10:03 <vmassol> sabageru: for ex if you go to http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/MaximeSinclair you'll see it's missing activity for stuff he did on subwikis  
10:03 <vmassol> he's just modified a page on the extensions wiki a few minutes ago for ex and he's done a lot of changes yesterday  
10:03 <vmassol> I think the combination of several params in the activity macro could be causing that  
10:03 <vmassol> let me get you the call  
10:04 <vmassol> {{activity authors="${doc.fullName}" wikis="xwiki,platform,enterprise,manager,extensions,dev,watch,xeclipse,xoffice,contrib" /}}  
10:04 <vmassol> could it be possible that the combination of authors and wikis fail somehow to take into account the specified wikis?  
10:04 <sabageru> the wikis seem to be correct ...  
10:04 <vmassol> let me check my profile  
10:05 <vmassol> yes that's it  
10:05 <vmassol> so when you use authors it "forgets" the wikis param  
10:05 <vmassol> I was pretty sure I created a jira issue for this  
10:05 <vmassol> looking for it again  
10:06 <sabageru> anyway, as you say, the issue is the fact that using authors param makes the macro forget the wikis param ?  
10:06 <sabageru> i could look into this one :)  
10:06 <vmassol> I think so  
10:06 <vmassol> ok thanks, it should be quite easy to fix I guess  
10:07 <vmassol> ok found it  
10:07 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-760  
10:08 <vmassol> (sabageru)  
10:08 <vmassol> ah raluca gave a comment but not a solution  
10:08 <vmassol> well she did give a solution  
10:08 <jstoldt> hmmm website survey is not available anymore but it's still linked  
10:09 <jstoldt> you might want to change either the availability or the link on the front page...  
10:09 <vmassol> jstoldt: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Survey works for me  
10:09 <jstoldt> i get "oops something went frong  
10:09 <jstoldt> do i need to be logged in?  
10:09 <vmassol> ah maybe didn't try this  
10:10 <vmassol> works too when not logged  
10:10 <vmassol> when does it fail jstoldt?  
10:10 <vmassol> after you fill the survey or before?  
10:10 <jstoldt> well, clicked it filled it, sent it, failed  
10:10 <jstoldt> so upon hitting submit it fails  
10:10 <vmassol> ah ok didn't try that part  
10:10 <sabageru> vmassol : as far as i remember, i did this modification for Raluca but i think it didn;t get commited on SVN. i will send an email to sdumitriu with a patch for this  
10:11 <jstoldt> saiys the form is no longer active  
10:11 <vmassol> sabageru: ok great thanks  
10:11 <sabageru> welcome :)  
10:11 <vmassol> jstoldt: ok I'll ask the person who set it up  
10:11 <jstoldt> cool  
10:11 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <mihaipaun> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <cjdelisle> g'mornin folks. Right hand menu vs. left hand reminds me of the big endians and the little endians.  
10:19 <cjdelisle> Unfortunately to change now would break the use flow for people who are experienced with it.  
10:20 <cjdelisle> That is one of my complaints with MICROS~1 every new version of windows requires learning a completely different interface.  
10:20 <jstoldt> vmassol: remember about the XARDiff app we discussed yesterday? well, just downloaded the standalone zip, logged on as Admin, imported xardiff, granted Admin group programming rights and clicked on the xardiff space... still getting velocity errors and some logging about a JVM BUG  
10:21 <jstoldt> cjdelisle: well, i don't think it really needs that much learning in the case of microsoft. however, you are right, it breaks the users expectations and that makes him a little quirky until he gets the hang of it  
10:22 <jstoldt> so from a usability point of view it's a little tricky... breaking new users expectations because they expect left menu, i think or breaking older users expectations who expect right menu  
10:23 <cjdelisle> Big arrow at the top which moves it back over?  
10:23 <cjdelisle> ^and saves in user profie  
10:23 <jstoldt> to be honest with you, i don't even know if you should bother at all...  
10:23 <jstoldt> like i said, it's not like it actually breaks anything and the reasoning the ergonomist gave you is very sound  
10:24 <jstoldt> so if it comes down to priorities and you say content is top priority you are better off the way you are now  
10:24 <cjdelisle> Mouse moves right, nothing there, bad feeling. Bad feelings don't explain themselves nor conform to logic.  
10:24 <jstoldt> yeah, it's really all about what you expect and what you know  
10:25 <cjdelisle> Be Apple, define the user's expectations.  
10:25 <jstoldt> i think most websites use left menu, thus new users expect the menus on the left. but users who've been around expect it to be right  
10:25 <jstoldt> so no matter what someone will have to addapt  
10:25 <jstoldt> lol, i'd rather not be apple  
10:25 <cjdelisle> They are very good at what they do.  
10:26 <jstoldt> but you are right, one of my teachers actually said they have a good design from a usability POV  
10:26 <jstoldt> but i would not go as far as call them revolutionairies...  
10:27 <cjdelisle> I'm not praising them, I think it's overpriced tethered equipment. However their marketing is genius.  
10:27 <jstoldt> yeah, sure as hell is. apple is 90% about marketing and designing for the hippster non-technical users now  
10:28 <+sburjan> cjdelisle: do you have experience with Memtest ?  
10:28 <cjdelisle> yup  
10:28 <cjdelisle> memtest86  
10:28 <+sburjan> yes  
10:28 <+sburjan> prv :)  
10:28 <cjdelisle> run on all new computers

11:01 <vmassol> jstoldt: re xardiff I don't know. I won't have much time today to look into this unfortunately  
11:01 <jstoldt> no worries, i'll be out of office startin 1 pm until 4th of january  
11:01 <vmassol> did you try debugging it?  
11:02 <jstoldt> so don't rush it  
11:02 <jstoldt> well, i don't get any further than the parsing  
11:02 <vmassol> since it's working for me it's going to be hard for me to fix it  
11:02 <jstoldt> so i figure it has something to do with the parse function here...  
11:02 <jstoldt> dunno what else i could try to debug this  
11:02 <vmassol> you don't even need to grant rights to anyone  
11:02 <vmassol> just log with Admin  
11:02 <jstoldt> i did  
11:03 <jstoldt> that's the weird thing  
11:03 <vmassol> you do need to edit the script though  
11:03 <vmassol> to set the correct jars to download  
11:03 <jstoldt> logged on as admin and granted admin group programming rights  
11:03 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
11:03 <vmassol> there's no ui  
11:03 <jstoldt> yeah, i know, i tried that but like i said, if i remove anything but the parsing from the velocity script it still fails  
11:04 <jstoldt> so it's got to be related to the parsing  
11:10 <jvelo> has quit  
11:13 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
11:17 <jvelo> sdumitriu, no I did not spend time debugging myxwiki lately  
11:17 <jvelo> it's still misbehaving ?  
11:17 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
11:17 <@sdumitriu> jvelo: hudson agent-1 is stuck  
11:17 <@sdumitriu> Can you restart it? OOM  
11:27 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: I have a class, a sheet and an object attached to XWiki.XWikiPreferences . I'll like to add a section that uses the sheet in inline mode. I can't find a way to do that. Is it possible without changing to much XWiki.AdminSheet ?  
11:27 <jvelo> jvdrean, can you restart the agent ?  
11:28 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: You should use the Configurable class  
11:29 <jvelo> I'd prefer you guys (=xwiki development team) are responsible for hudson and other xwiki.org resources as much as possible  
11:29 <jvelo> sdumitriu, do you have access to the machine ?  
11:29 <@sdumitriu> Yes, but I don't know what to do  
11:29 <@sdumitriu> And I don't have sudo access  
11:30 <@sdumitriu> Teach me and I'll stop nagging you  
11:30 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: I can't. (1) it doesn't follow the form standards and (2) I have to control the form fields because I have to replace some of them with advanced "editors".  
11:30 <jvelo> sdumitriu, hehe I don't know what to do either  
11:30 <jvelo> let me see  
11:31 <jvelo> I don't even know which machine it is  
11:32 <jstoldt> i want to try to change a bit of DefaultOpenOfficeDocumentConverter.java... what would be the best way to go about this?  
11:34 <@sdumitriu> jvelo: ssh [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
11:34 <jvelo> yep  
11:34 <jvelo> trying to log in now  
11:34 <jvelo> ok I'm in  
11:34 <jvelo> (the machine is not listed on our inventory that's why it took so long)  
11:34 <+jvdrean> jvelo: just seen your message  
11:34 <jvelo> (I'll ask for having it listed)

11:35 <@sdumitriu> How?  
11:36 <@sdumitriu> bin/hudson.sh?  
11:36 <jvelo> I'm looking in hudsinagen bash history  
11:36 <+jvdrean> yes I think so  
11:37 <jvelo> I see releases...  
11:37 <esdaniel> has left #xwiki

11:37 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
11:37 <@sdumitriu> Executing hudson.sh

11:39 <@sdumitriu> But it throws an OOM  
11:39 <+jvdrean> but there's a problem http://hudson.xwiki.org/computer/agent-1/log

12:24 <vmassol> hudson ui  
12:24 <@sdumitriu> Restart what?

12:24 <vmassol> (just catching up)

12:25 <@sdumitriu> (planning)

12:26 <+lucaa> sdumitriu: what are you releasing now?  
12:26 <+lucaa> 2.7RC1?  
12:26 <@sdumitriu> 2.7 final  
12:26 <+lucaa> hmm...  
12:26 <+lucaa> can I still commit XWIKI-5817?  
12:27 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
12:27 <@sdumitriu> But be quick  
12:27 <+lucaa> ok, I will do my best  
12:27 <jstoldt> be sure to update the translation files, too ;)  
12:27 <+lucaa> thanks  
12:27 <jstoldt> @ sdumitriu  
12:27 <+lucaa> jstoldt: which translation files?  
12:27 <+lucaa> you mean other languages?  
12:28 <jstoldt> yeah, because i already translated those new strings and it would be a shame to mess out on them in the final  
12:28 <+lucaa> well, I would say that's a bit late for that  
12:28 <+lucaa> sdumitriu: ?  
12:28 <vmassol> lucaa: no  
12:28 <+lucaa> no?  
12:28 <vmassol> it's part of the releease process  
12:28 <+lucaa> what no?  
12:28 <+lucaa> ah, ok great  
12:28 <vmassol> it's not too late  
12:28 <+lucaa> kool  
12:28 <+lucaa> lemme commit  
12:29 <jstoldt> yep, that's why i wanted to remind sdumitriu in case he already did that bit  
12:29 <vmassol> checking french translation level  
12:29 <+lucaa> well in case he already did that bit then it's late  
12:29 <+lucaa> if not, then it's not  
12:29 <jstoldt> ^^  
12:29 <@sdumitriu> jstoldt: It's in the release plans, it won't be forgotten  
12:29 <jstoldt> :-D great  
12:30 <vmassol> hmm still 50 empty translations for French  
12:30 <jstoldt> yeah, i think the said issue created another 42...

12:34 <+lucaa> yes, yes I am doing it  
12:36 <vmassol> lucaa: do you consider layout to be decoration?  
12:36 <+lucaa> yes  
12:37 <@sdumitriu> But I don't want to release the root pom again... Is http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-792 so important?  
12:38 <vmassol> ok I thought decoration == style  
12:40 <+lucaa> sdumitriu: isn't this what's causing http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests-2.6/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/58/testReport/org.xwiki.test.webstandards.framework/DefaultValidationTest/Validating\_XHTML\_validity\_for\_\_space\_Sandbox\_\_page\_WebHome\_executed\_with\_credentials\_Admin\_admin/ ?  
12:40 <+lucaa> jvdrean: ?  
12:40 <+lucaa> (I mean, might it be?)  
12:41 <@sdumitriu> lucaa: Are you sure you gave the right link? It's PASSED for me  
12:41 <+lucaa> sdumitriu: no  
12:41 <jstoldt> XWIKI-5825 published  
12:41 <+lucaa> I just realized XWIKI-5824 is wrongly created as an issue  
12:41 <+lucaa> it's an issue for non-released stuff  
12:42 <vmassol> sdumitriu: i think so  
12:42 <+lucaa> I'm gonna convert it into a task for XWIKI-5817  
12:42 <jstoldt> yeah, i made it thus because i did not know if you were going to make it for this release...  
12:43 <+lucaa> jstoldt: but as long as you don't have an "affects version" to fill in \_for sure\_ you don't create it in advance, I would say  
12:43 <+lucaa> anyway  
12:44 <jstoldt> okay, will stop guessing so much. sorry for the trouble, i am not too familiar with how you handle these things  
12:44 <+lucaa> vmassol: would subtask work? subtask also has an issue number and appears in the fixed issues list...  
12:44 <vmassol> don't use subtaks as much as possible  
12:45 <vmassol> not sure why you'd want to use them either  
12:45 <+lucaa> jstoldt:  http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentPractices#HJIRABestPractices  
12:45 <vmassol> lucaa: this is not for users  
12:45 <vmassol> it's for us devs  
12:45 <+lucaa> really?  
12:45 <vmassol> yes  
12:45 <vmassol> that's why it's on dev.xwiki.org  
12:45 <vmassol> :)

19:03 <@sdumitriu> Found the problem with adding new group objects  
19:04 <abusenius> has quit  
19:04 <sabageru> has quit  
19:04 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
19:05 <@sdumitriu> I don't know why it ever worked  
19:05 <cjdelisle> ^I hate those  
19:14 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Haha, it's you  
19:14 <@sdumitriu> r31011  
19:14 <@sdumitriu> XWIKI-5474  
19:15 <@sdumitriu> The problem is that XWikiGroup objects are loaded in a different branch of the code  
19:15 <@sdumitriu> One that only works after the object HAS stored values  
19:15 <@sdumitriu> But normally an object is added without values, then the values are saved when putting real values in the UI  
19:16 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
19:17 <cjdelisle> So the group has to be in the cache before it can be loaded from the store?  
19:17 <@sdumitriu> Not quite  
19:17 <@sdumitriu> That would be weird  
19:18 <@sdumitriu> Look in XWikiHibernateStore#loadXWikiDoc  
19:18 <@sdumitriu> Around line 778  
19:18 <@sdumitriu> if (hasGroups)  
19:18 <@sdumitriu> The query joins StringProperty for the member, but there's no member  
19:19 <@sdumitriu> I wonder if that branch is really needed  
19:19 <@sdumitriu> It's very old  
19:19 <@sdumitriu> Probably some workaround for even older code  
19:20 <cjdelisle> I still don't see where it should fail with the document not being put in the cache.  
19:20 <@sdumitriu> OK, how it used to work:  
19:22 <@sdumitriu> 1. add object -> creates empty BaseObject  
19:22 <@sdumitriu> 2. save document  
19:22 <@sdumitriu> 2'. save BaseObject  
19:22 <@sdumitriu> 2''. save object properties, but there aren't any  
19:22 <@sdumitriu> 3. set new document in the cache, containing the Group object  
19:22 <@sdumitriu> ...  
19:22 <@sdumitriu> 4. try to save the new object values  
19:22 <@sdumitriu> 5. when requesting the document to do that, the group object is there, set the new properties to it  
19:22 <@sdumitriu> How it works now:  
19:22 <@sdumitriu> 1. add object -> creates empty BaseObject  
19:22 <@sdumitriu> 2. save document  
19:22 <@sdumitriu> 2'. save BaseObject  
19:22 <@sdumitriu> 2''. save object properties, but there aren't any  
19:23 <@sdumitriu> 3. there's no document in the cache, and don't put any  
19:23 <@sdumitriu> ...  
19:23 <@sdumitriu> 4. try to save the new object values  
19:24 <@sdumitriu> 5. when requesting the document to do that, the group object is skipped (line 757), and the hasGroups branch query fails  
19:24 <@sdumitriu> 6. No group object!  
19:24 <cjdelisle> How it works now: 3.  
19:25 <@sdumitriu> So the behavior was broken before as well, but it just wasn't noticed because of the cache  
19:25 <cjdelisle> You get the document, this will pull from the db because the cache has been cleared correct?  
19:25 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
19:25 <cjdelisle> So you will have your empty groups object.  
19:26 <@sdumitriu> Yes, but onle the BaseObject, not the StringProperty  
19:27 <@sdumitriu> Sorry, not line 757, but 751  
19:27 <@sdumitriu>                     if (classReference.equals(groupsDocumentReference)) {  
19:27 <@sdumitriu>                         hasGroups = true;  
19:27 <@sdumitriu>                         continue;  
19:27 <@sdumitriu>                     }  
19:27 <cjdelisle> That's looking for an object, not a property correct?  
19:28 <sburjan\_> has quit  
19:28 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
19:28 <cjdelisle> I'm not figuring where the StringProperty is needed.  
19:28 <@sdumitriu> Here:  
19:28 <@sdumitriu>                 if (hasGroups) {  
19:28 <@sdumitriu>                     Query query2 = session.createQuery("select bobject.number, prop.value from StringProperty as prop, "  
19:28 <@sdumitriu>                         + "BaseObject as bobject where bobject.name = :name and bobject.className='XWiki.XWikiGroups' "  
19:28 <@sdumitriu>                         + "and bobject.id=prop.id.id and prop.id.name='member' order by bobject.number");  
19:29 <cjdelisle> Ok so there will not be a string property.  
19:29 <cjdelisle> Where is that property required?  
19:30 <cjdelisle> "when requesting the document to do that, the group object is there, set the new properties to it"  
19:31 <cjdelisle> ^The \_object\_ should still be there.  
19:31 <@sdumitriu> Nope, because of the continue at 751  
19:32 <@sdumitriu> The object is not added to the document, because "it will be added in the hasGroups branch"  
19:32 <@sdumitriu> But that doesn't happen  
19:32 <cjdelisle> oh so an XWikiGroups object with no members ceases to exist.  
19:33 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
19:33 <florinciu> has quit  
19:33 <@sdumitriu> I really think that the hasGroups branch is no longer needed  
19:33 <cjdelisle> What was it for originally?  
19:33 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
19:36 <@sdumitriu> No idea  
19:36 <@sdumitriu> That's ancient history  
19:36 <cjdelisle> I have a wild guess :)  
19:36 <cjdelisle> It looks a lot like my patch for loadXWikiDoc.  
19:36 <cjdelisle> I think it's performance.  
19:37 <cjdelisle> one query to load all of the objects. That could make a huge difference if XWikiAllGroup gets loaded on a large server.

21:35 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Back, did you look into the groups problem anymore?  
21:36 <cjdelisle> No. I think you found the problem and I think that change was for performance.  
21:36 <@sdumitriu> OK  
21:36 <@sdumitriu> Just checking  
21:36 <@sdumitriu> So yes, it might have been done for performance  
21:36 <@sdumitriu> But it's bad  
21:37 <@sdumitriu> It looses objects, and it looses GUIDs  
21:38 <cjdelisle> What I'm worried about is if you remove it, big farms like myxwiki might cease up from the db hit increase.  
21:40 <@sdumitriu> That's why we need to have XWikiAllGroup fully virtual by default  
21:40 <@sdumitriu> myxwiki already has it  
21:40 <cjdelisle> What does that mean?  
21:42 <@sdumitriu> It means that no objects are created for XWikiAllGroup  
21:42 <cjdelisle> So it's a separate db table?  
21:45 <@sdumitriu> No  
21:45 <@sdumitriu> It's implicit  
21:46 <cjdelisle> it's virtual, no objects are created, and it's implicit.  
21:46 <cjdelisle> That doesn't help me understand it very much.  
22:00 <@sdumitriu> It means that the group management module answers "yes" whenever asked if any user is a member of XWiki.XWikiAllGroup, without checking  
22:00 <@sdumitriu> (except for XWikiGuest)  
22:00 <@sdumitriu> And it means that when registering a new user, a new member object is not added to XWikiAllGroup  
22:01 <cjdelisle> Oh I see.  
22:02 <cjdelisle> OTOH  String guestGroup = "XWiki.XWikiGuest";   is horrible and evil.  
22:08 <cjdelisle> got XMLWriter to do pretty indentation and it passes the parse, serialize, string compare test.  
22:11 <cjdelisle> writeOpen() and writeClose() didn't do indentation or add newlines.
